description: Erection of side/rear boundary wall with sliding metal gate to a maximum height of 2.08mÂ (RETROSPECTIVE).
decision_conditions: The proposed front boundary, by virtue of its excessive height, design and materials, including the combined overall height of the pillars and gate, is a significantly dominant and harmful boundary treatment which is out of keeping with the prevailing character and appearance of the subject property and the surrounding area. The proposal is not well designed and is contrary to policies DMD8, DMD 37, and DMD 47 of the Development Management Document (2014), to policy CP30 of the Core Strategy (2010), to policies D3 and D8 of the London Plan (2021) and to the National Planning Policy Framework (2024).

The proposal, due to its scale, siting and lack of acceptable visibility splays, gives rise to conditions prejudicial to the free flow and safety of vehicular traffic, cyclists and pedestrians, contrary to Policies T2 and T4 of the London Plan (2021), to policies CP24 and CP25 of the Enfield Core Strategy (2010), to policies DMD46 and DMD47 of the Enfield Development Management Document (2014), to Section 9 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2024), and to the Revised Technical Standards for Footway Crossovers (2013).
